Threat Assessment Letter in English
Threat Assessment Letter in Arabic

The Crestwood School District will become an exemplary learning community that supports innovation, career and college readiness for all students, professional growth for teachers and staff, and will be committed to embracing community involvement.
The Crestwood School District, together with the community, prepares learners to be their best in a global and diverse society by:

ul.li: Providing rigorous, relevant and engaging instruction in a safe nurturing environment
Creating a culture that maximizes learning through high expectations
Promoting students to become responsible citizens

h3.a: Click here to view a video update from Dr. Mossallam

br.a: COVID-19 and Crestwood Schools Update April 13, 2020

div.p: Dr. Mosallam updates the community on next steps for the Crestwood School District. We as a School District and a Team of Professional Educators will continue to address all needs and make accommodations during this unprecedented shutdown and quarantine. Also, please share the information with anyone you may know does not have access to the internet. A letter will be coming home shortly.

New program provides temporary meal funding for families affected by the pandemic.

img.a: COVID-19 Letter from Dr. Mosallam Update 4-13-2020

p.strong: An update concerning Governor Whitmer's Executive Order in reference to enrichment activities and student grades.

div.p:
The Crestwood Schools and the Wayne County Superintendents will be reviewing Governor Whitmer's Executive Order and we will have more details to share once we have more information. Please see the attached letter that discusses the direction we are heading as a school and community. Again, more details will be shared once we review the Executive Order in its entirety.
Crestwood School District COVID-19 School Closure Update 4-2-2020
Crestwood School District COVID-19 School Closure Update 4-2-2020 Translated

Dear Crestwood Community,
Crestwood Public Schools is dedicated to continually supporting you through this crisis. Food Distribution will resume on Tuesday, April 14, 2020. We will continue to provide families with seven days of breakfast and lunch during our meal pick up times starting at 11 am each Tuesday. Please try to get to the distribution locations of Highview Elementary and Riverside Middle School as close to the start of the pick up time as possible.
If your family is in need of assistance in order to acquire additional funds for the provision of food, please visit the State of Michigan website:
https://newmibridges.michigan.gov/
In addition to adding some funds to current Bridge card holder accounts for families with children, the MDHHS has eliminated some requirements and wait times to assist families in qualifying for a food assistance card in a quicker and more inclusive manner. Eligible families do not need to re-apply to receive the additional benefits if they currently have a card.
Stay safe and healthy!

strong.a: Zaman hopes to provide support families experiencing food insecurity and basic needs challenges. Read their notice here.

div.h3: up to date news and events

img.alt: Career Tech Partners, Crestwood School District, Dearborn Heights, No. 7, Westwood School District

div.span: Several years ago, the three districts in Dearborn Heights entered into a vocational partnership. This endeavor has enabled the districts to provide upgraded programs, facilities, and to avoid duplication costs.
- Letter from the Superintendent - Parent & Athlete Concussion Information Sheet - Medical Clearance to Return to Play

img.alt: Find us on facebook. Updates, Pictures and Events
Image text reads: Give Michigan kids a Great Start.

div.span: GSRP is a state-funded preschool program for 4 year olds who may be at risk of educational failure. Provided by the Michigan Department of Education, GSRP is administered by Wayne County RESA. The program is housed at CHBC and is designed to offer high-quality preschool and strengthen learning at home.

img.alt: Image of a Sea Turtle in Silhouette. Image text reads: Sea Turtle Swim School
Image of Michigan State Capital Building.

div.span: The Crestwood School District is looking for parents who are willing to serve as volunteers for a Crestwood Legislative Parent Network. The volunteers will receive information regarding school legislation in Lansing and will be asked to represent our district through e-mail communications. Please contact the Superintendent's Office, 313-278-0903, if you are interested.

img.alt: Image of colored hand prints. Image text reads: Pre-School
Text in image reads: Stand up 4 Public Schools.

div.span: MASB has joined NSBA's Stand Up 4 Public Schools campaign to support public education with various activities throughout the Association and the state.

div.span: KINDERGARTEN THROUGH GRADE 12 REGISTRATION Monday - Friday, 7:30 am – 4:00 pm For more information on registration please contact the Crestwood Board of Education 313-278-0906.

img.alt: Image of Riverside Middle School. Text in image reads: Welcome to our Neighborhood. A video project by RMS Students.

div.span: Take a peek inside our own Riverside Middle School

img.alt: Text in image reads: High School Weather Station, WeatherBug.

div.span: Welcome to Crestwood High School's weather reporting system, stationed at the high school. Our data is being streamed live to various meteorological organizations & is used for the basis of some local, regional, & global forecasting. We hope you find this information useful as you plan outdoor activities. Our students utilize this data in various weather/climate activities & as the basis of authentic science research. Click MORE for Online Weather Station Access.

div.h2: Robotics Team Needs Help From the Community
div.p: Our Crestwood Robotics teams are helping donate needed Personal Protection Equipment (PPE) to hospitals in our area. See the ProtoBots website for details on how you can help.

img.alt: Image text reads: School Bond Information Vote.

div.span: Essential upgrades in safety & security, technology, and buildings

p.strong:
May 4, 2016
This is truly a testament to “Every Vote Counts”! We would like to thank everyone for your support and coming out to vote. We would also like to thank all of the Bond Committee members and all of the volunteers for their hard work. Congratulations!!!!.

div.h3: begins January 6, 2020 for neighborhood School Placement.

p.strong: Children must be 5 years old by 9-1-20 to attend. For more information contact the Crestwood Board of Education Monday - Friday 7:30 am - 3:00 pm, 313-278-0906.
